page.title: 05M.25 MOTORWAY
page.content: The Balfour Beatty site offices,storage dept and temporary housing site for its construction workers is in South Mimms and the large plant used in construction is a daily sight on local roads.The builders are careful to keep mud pff the roads as this could be a hazard.Road sweepers as well as road-side wheel cleaning devices are situated around the site Before building the motorway the area had to be levelled and the company expected to move about 6000000m3 of earth to make cuttings and embankments.Drains have also had to be laid to carry away water which could cause subsidence later.Only then can the various layers of the motorway's foundations be laid and the final 'black top' of tarmac be put down.
